item.title: 印度资金管理公司 EAAA 为私人信贷融资 5.1 亿美元
item.description: EAAA India Alternatives Ltd. 为其首个私人信贷基金筹集了 450 亿卢比（约合 5.1 亿美元），该基金专注于特殊情况，如企业扭亏为盈，资金全部来自国内投资者。【原文：EAAA India Alternatives Ltd. raised 45 billion rupees ($510 million) for its first private credit fund that focuses on special situations such as business turnaround cases using money collected entirely from domestic investors.】

item.title: 贵金属需求激增，黄金接近创纪录水平
item.description: 由于美联储降息的前景以及人们对央行未来的日益担忧，贵金属多年来的涨势又有了新的动力。【原文：Gold held just below a record high and silver traded above $40 an ounce, as the prospect of Federal Reserve rate cuts and growing concerns over the central bank’s future gave fresh legs to the multi-year rally in precious metals.】

item.title: 击败 95% 同行的亚洲基金看好芯片齿轮制造商
item.description: 与美国同行相比，中国芯片制造商的股价处于四年来的高位，但一位顶级基金经理仍然认为，这些设备供应商中仍有机会。【原文：Chinese chipmakers are trading at a four-year high versus their US peers, but a top fund manager still sees pockets of opportunity among their equipment suppliers.】

item.title: 交易商等待欧佩克+会议和美国对俄罗斯的下一步行动，石油价格下跌
item.description: 由于交易商们在等待新的催化剂来推动油价走出一直以来相对狭窄的区间，因此油价一路走低，市场关注的焦点是即将召开的欧佩克+会议和美国对俄罗斯供应采取的行动。【原文：Oil drifted as traders waited for fresh catalysts to move prices out of what’s been a relatively narrow band, with attention on an upcoming OPEC+ meeting and US moves on Russian supplies.】

item.title: 西太平洋银行将招聘数百名银行家推动商业贷款业务
item.description: 西太平洋银行（Westpac Banking Corp.【原文：Westpac Banking Corp. plans to hire 350 bankers and turn more to artificial intelligence as it ramps up business lending.】

item.title: 台湾寿险公司货币对冲成本大幅下降
item.description: 台币近期的疲软以及由此导致的套利交易回潮正在迅速降低本地寿险公司的对冲成本。【原文：The Taiwan dollar’s recent weakness and the resulting return of carry trades are quickly driving down local life insurers’ hedging costs.】

item.title: 韩国通胀缓解，为韩国央行恢复减息提供更多空间
item.description: 韩国的消费通胀率降温到了今年以来最慢的速度，这为央行在 10 月份的下一次政策会议上恢复货币宽松周期提供了更大的空间。【原文：South Korea’s consumer inflation cooled to the slowest pace this year, giving the central bank more room to resume its monetary easing cycle at its next policy meeting in October.】

item.title: 随着外国人的退出，印度本地基金的股票购买量接近创纪录水平
item.description: 印度机构今年的股票购买量正逐步创下纪录，在外国基金不断抛售股票的情况下，这为印度 5.1 万亿美元的股票市场提供了缓冲。【原文：Stock purchases by Indian institutions are inching toward a record this year, providing a cushion to the nation’s $5.1 trillion market as foreign funds keep selling.】

item.title: 全球压力最大的债券将迎来传统上最糟糕的一个月
item.description: 如果从历史经验来看，较长期限的债券可能会在 9 月份遭遇波折。【原文：Longer-maturity bonds may be in for a treacherous September, if history is any guide.】

item.title: 石油上涨，亚洲股市开盘低迷：市场综述
item.description: 由于华尔街因假日休市，隔夜亚洲市场表现低迷，周二开盘后走势不温不火。【原文：Asian markets are poised for a tepid open on Tuesday after a subdued overnight session with Wall Street closed for a holiday.】

item.title: 中国铝厂正在变革，以摆脱惨烈的价格战
item.description:
萎靡不振的房地产行业和过剩的供应量共同作用，使企业为向供应链上游移动而苦苦挣扎。【原文：

The combination of an ailing property sector and excess supply has left companies battling to move up the supply chain.

】

item.title: 中国阅兵聚焦习近平讲话和先进无人机
item.description: 国家主席习近平将举行盛大阅兵式，纪念二战结束 80 周年，并展示中国日益增强的外交影响力和军事实力。【原文：President Xi Jinping is set to stage a major parade to mark 80 years since the end of World War II — and showcase China’s growing diplomatic sway and military might.】

item.title: 亚马逊将向新西兰数据中心投资 44 亿美元
item.description: 亚马逊表示，它计划在新西兰的数据中心投资超过 75 亿新西兰元（44 亿美元）。【原文：Amazon said it plans to invest more than NZ$7.5 billion ($4.4 billion) in data centers in New Zealand.】

item.title: 特朗普结束制裁后，叙利亚运送多年来首批石油货物
item.description: 随着西方制裁的解除，叙利亚饱受战争蹂躏的经济得到缓解，叙利亚多年来首次出口了 60 万桶重质原油。【原文：Syria exported 600,000 barrels of heavy crude in its first oil shipment in years, as the lifting of western sanctions brings relief to its war-ravaged economy.】

item.title: 日本央行加息路径和财政风险令日本 10 年期国债销售蒙上阴影
item.description: 在日本央行加息预期不断升温、政治不确定性日益加剧的背景下，日本周二的 10 年期国债拍卖将是对投资者偏好的一次关键考验。【原文：Japan’s 10-year government bond auction Tuesday will be a key test of investor appetite amid growing expectations of rate hikes by the Bank of Japan and mounting political uncertainty.】

item.title: 游说团体称，欧盟不完善的银行联盟困住了 2,250 亿欧元的资本
item.description: 据一个行业游说团体称，欧盟未能打破各国银行业市场之间的壁垒，导致大型贷款机构的 2,250 亿欧元（2,625 亿美元）资本被困，而这些资本中的大部分本可用于支持其业务。【原文：The European Union’s failure to break down barriers between national banking markets has trapped €225 billion ($262.5 billion) of capital at big lenders, much of which they could use to support their business, according to an industry lobby.】

item.title: 台湾出口商面临本币走强的风险不断增加
item.description: 历史性的飙升使台币升至 2022 年以来的最强水平。这日益成为该国出口大国企业的头疼问题。【原文：A historic surge elevated the Taiwan dollar to its strongest level since 2022. That’s increasingly becoming a headache for the country’s export-heavy corporates.】

item.title: 业绩不佳拖累澳大利亚股市盈利前景
item.description: 在经历了一个令股价大跌的惨淡财报季之后，澳大利亚最大公司的盈利预期正在下滑。【原文：Earnings expectations for Australia’s biggest companies are slipping after a bleak reporting season that jolted shares.】

item.title: 硅谷推动人工智能进入美国学校的努力正在奏效
item.description:
全国各地的教育工作者正在将聊天机器人引入他们的教学计划。这是否有助于孩子们的学习，抑或只是另一种注定要失败的教育科技时尚？【原文：

Educators across the country are bringing chatbots into their lesson plans. Will it help kids learn or is it just another doomed ed-tech fad?

】

item.title: 瑞穗计划进行更多交易，以成为亚洲顶级投资银行
item.description: 瑞穗金融集团（Mizuho Financial Group Inc.【原文：Mizuho Financial Group Inc. is aiming to become Asia’s top investment bank by bolstering equity underwriting and M&A advisory, seeking to replicate the headways the firm has made in the US.】

item.title: 澳大利亚第二大养老金公司削减国债押注美国风险上升
item.description: 由于担心华盛顿的政策可能会刺激通货膨胀，澳大利亚第二大养老基金越来越看空美国国债。【原文：Australia’s second-biggest pension fund has grown increasingly bearish on US Treasuries due to concerns that Washington’s policies may stoke inflation.】

item.title: 泰国政局动荡威胁经济增长，降息预期升温
item.description: 随着泰国主要政党争相组建新政府，经济学家认为经济增长面临更多风险，大幅降息的可能性也在上升。【原文：With Thailand’s major political parties vying to form a new government — which may last only a few months — economists see further risks to economic growth and rising odds of steeper interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 德意志银行缺席七年后将重新加入欧洲斯托克 50 指数
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）在被剔除出欧元区主要股票基准七年后，重新跻身欧元区主要股票基准行列。【原文：Deutsche Bank AG has regained its spot in the euro area’s main stock benchmark, seven years after being cast out of the gauge.】

item.title: 阿根廷纸浆制造商寻求破产保护，将责任归咎于米莱公司
item.description: 纸浆和纸张制造商 Celulosa Argentina SA 周一申请破产保护，指责哈维尔-米莱伊总统的政府为当地工业创造了恶劣的商业环境。【原文：Pulp and paper manufacturer Celulosa Argentina SA filed for bankruptcy protection Monday, blaming the government of President Javier Milei for creating a bad business environment for local industry.】

item.title: 干扰欧盟委员会主席航班的 GPS 干扰是怎么回事？
item.description: 8 月 31 日，一架搭载欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）的飞机在飞往保加利亚普罗夫迪夫（Plovdiv）途中遭遇 GPS 导航故障，该国当局称信号很可能受到了俄罗斯的干扰。【原文：After a plane carrying European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen suffered a GPS navigation outage on its approach to Plovdiv in Bulgaria on Aug. 31, authorities in the country said the signal had likely been jammed by Russia.】

item.title: CapVest 以 100 亿欧元收购 Stada，跃入 PE 巨头行列
item.description: 今年欧洲最大的杠杆收购并非由黑石集团或 KKR & Co.等华尔街巨头完成。Co.等华尔街巨头完成的，而是一家名不见经传的英国私募股权公司，该公司管理着 120 亿欧元（约合 140 亿美元）的资金。【原文：Europe’s largest leveraged buyout this year wasn’t done by a Wall Street giant like Blackstone Inc. or KKR & Co. Instead, it’s from a lesser-known British private equity firm that manages just €12 billion ($14 billion).】

item.title: 尼日利亚削减石油公司成本回收上限以增加预算收入
item.description: 在原油价格下跌有可能扩大西非国家预算赤字的情况下，尼日利亚为增加政府收入，降低了石油公司收回成本的门槛。【原文：Nigeria has set a lower threshold by which oil companies can recover their expenses as it seeks to boost government revenue amid lower crude oil prices threatening to widen the budget deficit in the West African nation.】

item.title: 瑞士信贷首创的掉期交易在战争时代焕发新生
item.description: 瑞士信贷银行（Credit Suisse）为资助自然保护而首创的债务转换正在焕发第二春，因为银行家们看到了将这种模式应用于从战后重建到能源安全等一切领域的机会。【原文：Debt swaps pioneered by Credit Suisse to fund nature conservation are enjoying a second life, as bankers see an opportunity to apply the model to everything from post-war reconstruction to energy security.】

item.title: Glencore 考虑在南非铬铁企业裁员
item.description: Glencore Plc 在南非的铬铁合资企业表示，在关闭部分工厂数月后，该公司已开始进行重组谈判，这可能会导致裁员。【原文：Glencore Plc’s ferrochrome venture in South Africa said it’s started restructuring talks that may lead to job losses months after shuttering some of its plants.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯、伊拉克在制裁后停止向纳亚拉运送石油
item.description: 位于印度西部的纳亚拉能源有限公司炼油厂遭到欧盟制裁后，沙特阿拉伯和伊拉克不再向该炼油厂运送任何原油。【原文：Saudi Arabia and Iraq aren’t shipping any crude to Nayara Energy Ltd.’s refinery in western India after it was sanctioned by the European Union.】
